ratio_and_proportion.question: If A:B=5:7 and B:C=6:11, then A:B:C is:
If A:B=8:15, B:C=5:8 and C:D=4:5 then A:D is equal to:
If 2A=3B=4C then A:B:C is:
If x:y=5:2, then (8x+9y):(8x+2y) is:
The salaries of A, B, C are in the ratio 2:3:5. After 15%, 10%, and 20% increments respectively, what is the new ratio?
Rs.782 is divided in the ratio 1/2:2/3:3/4. The first part is:
Two numbers are in the ratio 3:5. Subtracting 9 from each gives 12:23. The smaller number is:
Rs.1210 is divided among A, B, and C in the ratio A:B = 5:4, B:C = 9:10. What does C get?
The ratio of three numbers is 3:4:5. If their squares sum to 1250, the sum of the numbers is:
Income of A and B are in ratio 6:5; expenses in 9:7. Both save Rs.1500. Total income?
If 4A = 5B and 6B = 7C, then A:B:C = ?
If 2x = 3y and 4y = 5z, then x:y:z = ?
A sum is divided between A and B in the ratio 7:5. A gets Rs.84 more. Find the sum.
If a:b = 3:4 and b:c = 2:5, find a:b:c
Divide Rs.420 between A, B, and C in ratio 2:3:4.
Find the fourth proportional to 3, 5, and 15.
Find the third proportional to 4 and 8.
If a:b = 5:6 and b:c = 7:8, find a:c
A and B earn in the ratio 3:4 and spend in the ratio 4:5. Who saves more?
If A:B = 2:3, B:C = 4:5, then A:B:C = ?

average.question: 5 years ago, the average age of A, B, C, and D was 45. Now, with E, the average is 49. What is E's age?
3 years ago, the average age of a family of 5 members was 17. A baby was born since then, and the average is still the same. What is the baby's current age?
The average weight of 50 students is 45 kg. One leaves and the average drops by 0.1 kg. What was the weight of the student who left?
The average age of 36 students is 27. One leaves and the average increases by 3 months. What is the age of the student who left?
Average weight of a group is 40 kg. A 58.5 kg boy joins, and average increases by 0.5 kg. How many were in the group originally?
Find the average of all even numbers between 104 and 148.
Average of 9 consecutive numbers is n. If 2 more added, what happens to average?
What is the average of 1,3,5,7,... up to 25 terms?
Average of first 4 even numbers divisible by 9?
Average of first 10 even numbers divisible by 8?
Find average of first 5 odd numbers divisible by 7.
In first 10 overs, run rate is 3.2. To reach 282 in 50 overs, required rate in remaining 40 overs is:
Average of 5, 10, 15, 20, 25 is:
If average of 7 numbers is 20, what is their total?
Average of first 10 natural numbers:
Average of first 10 multiples of 3:
Average of first 5 prime numbers:
If the average of 3 numbers is 50, and two are 40 and 60, what's the third?
Average temperature of a week is 30°C. If one day's temp was 36°C, what's average of remaining days?

profit_and_loss.question: If a product is sold at Rs.120 with a profit of 20%, what is the cost price?
If the cost price is Rs.150 and loss is 10%, what is the selling price?
Profit = Rs.40, SP = Rs.240. What is the cost price?
Loss = Rs.25, CP = Rs.250. Find SP.
If selling price is Rs.500 and profit is 25%, find cost price.
A trader sells an item at a loss of 5%. CP = Rs.800. Find SP.
Profit of 10% on selling price = Rs.55. Find cost price.
Loss of 20% and cost price is Rs.1000. What is SP?
SP = Rs.660, profit = 10%. What is CP?
Profit of Rs.60 on Rs.240 CP. What is profit percentage?
A seller sells an article for Rs.1050 with 5% loss. What is the cost price?
Selling price = Rs.420, gain = 5%. What is cost price?
Loss = Rs.80, SP = Rs.720. What is CP?
Profit is 20%, CP is Rs.150. Find SP.
If SP = Rs.950 and CP = Rs.1000, find the loss percentage.
Gain of 12.5% means selling at how much more than CP of Rs.800?
A man sold two items for Rs.1000 each. On one he gained 25%, on the other he lost 25%. Overall result?
If an article is sold at a gain of 16%, then SP = ? (CP = Rs.250)
Marked price = Rs.1000, discount = 20%. What is selling price?
An article is sold at Rs.840 with 12% gain. What is cost price?

time_and_work.question: A can do a work in 10 days and B in 15 days. How long will they take together?
A is twice as good a worker as B. Together they finish a work in 12 days. In how many days will A do it alone?
A can do a job in 6 days, B in 8 days. How many days will they take working alternately starting with A?
If A and B can complete a job in 20 days together, and A alone can do it in 30 days, how many days will B take?
A does 1/2 of a job in 3 days. At the same rate, how many days will he take to finish the job?
A and B can complete a work in 12 days. B alone can complete it in 18 days. In how many days can A complete it alone?
If 12 men can complete a job in 15 days, how many men are needed to complete it in 10 days?
A and B can finish a job in 10 days. B alone can do it in 15 days. How many days A alone will take?
If A can do a job in 18 days and B in 12 days, how many days will it take together?
A can do a work in 16 days, B in 24 days. They work on alternate days starting with A. Total time to finish?
Three men A, B and C can complete a job in 12, 15, and 20 days respectively. How long together?
A is thrice as fast as B. Together they do the work in 12 days. How many days for B alone?
A and B can complete a work in 18 days. They start together, but A leaves after 6 days. B finishes the work in 12 more days. Time taken by B alone?
If A takes 10 hours to complete a task and B takes 15 hours, how long if both work together?
A can complete a job in 8 days, B in 12 days. They work together for 3 days. Work left?
If 8 men can build a wall in 12 days, how many days will 6 men take?
A and B can do a work in 20 days and 30 days respectively. After working together for 10 days, A leaves. Time for B to finish remaining?
20 women can do a work in 16 days. In how many days can 16 women complete the same work?
A can do a job in 4 days. B is 25% less efficient. Together they can do the job in?
If A and B together can complete a job in 10 days and B alone in 15 days, how long will A alone take?

reasoning_skills.question: Pointing to a photograph, Ram said, 'He is the son of the only son of my mother.' Who is the person in the photograph to Ram?
A is the father of B. But B is not the son of A. How's that possible?
If in a code, DOG is written as FQI, then CAT is written as:
If DELHI is coded as 73541 and CALCUTTA as 82589662, how is CALICUT coded?
M is the daughter of P. P is the wife of R. R is the father of S. How is S related to M?
If NORTH is coded as 67215 and SOUTH as 83915, how is NOURTH coded?
Introducing a man, a woman said, 'He is the only son of my mother’s husband.' Who is the man?
If WALK is coded as YCNM, what is TALK coded as?
In a certain code, BREAK is written as 51342 and RACK is written as 3412. How is BACK written?
A person walks 10 m north, then turns right and walks 5 m, then turns right again and walks 10 m. What direction is he now facing?
A man walks 4 km north, turns left, walks 3 km, turns left again and walks 4 km. How far is he from the starting point?
If the word ROAD is coded as URDG, how is FAST coded?
If in a code, TABLE is written as GZYOV, how is CHAIR written?
Rahul is the brother of Sonia. Sonia is the daughter of Meena. Meena is the wife of Raj. How is Raj related to Rahul?
If PENCIL is coded as QFODJM, what is ERASER coded as?
If 'MANGO' is written as 'NZOHQ', then 'APPLE' is written as:
A man walks 10 km north, then 6 km east. How far is he from the starting point?
Pointing to a woman, Raj said, 'She is the daughter of my grandfather’s only son.' Who is the woman?
If ENCRYPT is coded as FODSZQU, how is DECODE coded?
A boy is facing north. He turns 90° clockwise, then 180° counterclockwise. Which direction is he facing now?
